comments.content: it is very close, but the apostrophe is different
No, you’re just typing ' rather than ’.

Quite like Bayer Corps’ Light Roman too - use a comma.

 ![](files/Picture%201.gif)
  
or Medium - aren’t they nice.
 ![](files/Picture%202.gif)
  
But I think Raph has it right.
 ![](files/Picture%203.gif)

[Engravers’ Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20070104010714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=BT.107554.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Kyle%E2%80%99s&sampleSize=48) with the correct apostrophe. Funny how they settled for the font’s poor spacing. Didn’t think to bring the ‘s’ in a bit.
